description: EJ, 24, was spotted in Los Angeles on Thursday. The son of basketball player Magic Johnson, EJ has been making a name for himself after starring on the E! reality series, Rich Kids Of Beverly Hills.
title: EJ Johnson shows off sculpted shape at Hermes show in LA
title_page: EJ Johnson shows off sculpted shape at Hermes show in LA | Daily Mail Online
text:
He knows how to get people talking with his fashion sense.
And EJ Johnson was at it again as he attended the Hermes show in Los Angeles on Thursday.
The 24-year-old Rich Kids Of Beverly Hills star showed off his sculpted shape in a completely sheer black top and skirt with two thigh-high slits.
It's a sheer thing! EJ Johnson showed off his sculpted shape in a completely sheer black top and skirt with two thigh-high slits as he arrived to the Hermes show in Los Angeles on Thursday
EJ's off-the-shoulder mesh top featured long sleeves that showed off his toned arms.
His skirt cinched into his torso, and he strode on in a pair of black ankle boots.
EJ accessorized the look with two sparkling choker necklaces and carried a sophisticated purple crocodile print purse.
And topping off the glamorous ensemble, the reality star had smoky eye shadow, dewy skin, and a nude color on his lips.
Toned and terrific! EJ's off-the-shoulder mesh top featured long sleeves that showed off his toned arms
Finishing touches: His skirt cinched into his torso, and he strode on in a pair of black ankle boots
The son of basketball player Magic Johnson, EJ has been making a name for himself after starring on the E! reality series, Rich Kids Of Beverly Hills.
Since then, EJ has landed his own spin-off show, EJNYC, on the same network.
Speaking of making educational reality television to ET Online in June, EJ said: 'Why else would you be watching something on television if youâ€™re not learning something?'
'I really wanted to do that with this show, for people to learn.'
The show premiered in June 2016, but in November, it was reported by the same outlet that EJNYC would not be returning to the network.
